title: Manmohan Singh - Wikipedia
snippet: Manmohan Singh (26 September 1932 – 26 December 2024) was an Indian economist and statesman who served as the prime minister of India from 2004 to 2014. He was the fourth longest-serving prime minister after Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, and Narendra Modi.

title: Manmohan Singh | Biography, Reforms, Political Career, & Death | Britannica
snippet: He became prime minister in 2004 and was the first prime minister after Jawaharlal Nehru to return to the office after completing a full five-year term. He was succeeded by Narendra Modi in 2014.(more)

title: Manmohan Singh, India’s former prime minister and architect of economic reforms, dies at 92 | PBS News
snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who succeeded Singh in 2014, called him one of India’s “most distinguished leaders” who rose from humble origins and left “a strong imprint on our economic policy over the years.”

title: Manmohan Singh, the reformist leader who transformed India's economy | Latest News India - Hindustan Times
snippet: He first assumed office after the Congress secured victory in the 2004 Lok Sabha elections against Atal Bihari Vajpayee-led NDA. Following his second term from 2009 to 2014, he was succeeded by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Dr. Manmohan Singh | Prime Minister of India
snippet: Singh held several significant positions, including Secretary in the Ministry of Finance, Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, Advisor to the Prime Minister, and Chairman of the University Grants Commission.
